plants.name: Colchicum autumnale
plants.description: A perennial flowering plant native to Europe, known for its crocus-like flowers that bloom in fall when the leaves have died back, showcasing large, lily-like flowers.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Autumn Crocus is not a true crocus and contains colchicine, a toxic compound with medical applications.

plants.name: Osmanthus fragrans
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree famous for its intensely fragrant small flowers that bloom in autumn.
plants.location: East Asia, especially China and Japan
plants.funFact: Sweet Osmanthus flowers are used to scent tea and make perfumed oils in traditional Chinese culture.

plants.name: Rosa 'Paul Neyron'
plants.description: A cultivated garden rose variety that often blooms into early fall, producing very large, full-petaled pink flowers.
plants.funFact: Known as one of the largest roses, Paul Neyron blooms continuously and is valued for its ornamental appeal.

plants.name: Wisteria sinensis
plants.description: Though famous for spring blooms, the seed pods of Wisteria can mature and become quite prominent and aesthetically interesting by October, adding unique interest to gardens.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring flowering, seed pods visible in fall
colors: purple flowers in spring; seed pods brown in fall
plants.funFact: Wisteria vines can live over 100 years and their twisted trunks and branches add architectural beauty year-round.
